Definition.WordDefinition: KILT, n. A costume sometimes worn by Scotchmen in America and Americans in Scotland.

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Kilt \Kilt\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Kilted}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Kilting}.] To tuck up; to truss up, as the clothes. [Scot.] --Sir W. Scott. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44
The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Kilt \Kilt\, n. [OGael. cealt clothes, or rather perh. fr. Dan. kilte op to truss, tie up, tuck up.] A kind of short petticoat, reaching from the waist to the knees, worn in the Highlands of Scotland by men, and in the Lowlands by young boys; a filibeg. [Written also {kelt}.] [1913 Webster]
kilt n : a knee-length pleated tartan skirt worn by men in the Highlands of northern Scotland
